response_parsed.title: Implementing Microservices Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to create and deploy microservices using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+.
It provides automatic documentation, type checking, and supports multiple runtime environments.
This guide focuses on using FastAPI to develop microservices in Python 3.12+.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this guide, as FastAPI requires a minimum Python version of 3.7.
FastAPI version 0.65.2 was used during the creation of this guide. It's important to check for any updates or changes in newer versions.
caveats: FastAPI assumes you have some knowledge of Python and REST APIs. If you are new to these topics, it is recommended to first familiarize yourself with them.
This guide provides examples using SQLAlchemy for database interactions. It can be swapped out with any other ORM or data source as desired.
